title: The 12 Best Tennis Bags for On-Court Performance and Off-Court Style
description: Racket covers, backpacks, and convertible totes that’ll truly up your game.
excerpt: Shop tennis racket covers, tennis backpacks, and convertible tennis tote bags from Wilson, Tumi, Tory Burch, Louis Vuitton, and more that'll up your game.

Its interior and exterior pockets work just as well for holding water bottles and Pilates clothes as they do for stashing tennis balls and clay court tennis shoes. So, we asked Anisimova for tips on how to choose a tennis bag. Before shopping, you’ll need to determine what bag style and racket capacity you’re after. “A beginner player should shop for a tennis tote bag or backpack. Typically, when starting out, a player uses only two or three rackets, so a bag on the smaller side would be perfect. html:
Best Overall

Tory Burch Tory Sport Striped Tennis Tote

Pros
  • Convertible design with detachable racket pouch
  • Numerous interior and exterior pockets
Cons
  • Some reviewers worry about the light color

The beauty of this Tory Burch tennis tote isn’t its sporty striped trim—it’s a removable racket compartment that makes this understated bag even more versatile. Its interior and exterior pockets work just as well for holding water bottles and Pilates clothes as they do for stashing tennis balls and clay court tennis shoes.

Racket capacity: 2

Colors: Ivory with green trim or ivory with maroon trim

Materials: Coated canvas with faux leather trim and nylon lining

Customer review: “The fabric on this bag is very nice, and it gives the bag great structure, which makes it easy to find stuff. It’s the perfect size for a serious competitive/club player who always carries two rackets.”

Best Minimalist Racket Cover

Mark Cross for AERIN Racquet Cover

Pros
  • Luxe materials
  • Detachable strap
  • Suede lining
Cons
  • Doesn’t offer additional storage

Leather goods brand Mark Cross created this Italian-made sleek canvas and leather cover in partnership with the lifestyle brand AERIN, and I can’t think of a more elevated item to carry your racket. Talk about chic.

Racket capacity: 1

Colors: Canvas with Vacchetta Trim

Material: Cotton canvas and vacchetta calfskin leather

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best Tennis Backpack

Tumi Tennis Backpack

Pros
  • Can be monogrammed with custom initials
  • Hidden metal hook for easy hanging
  • Water-resistant water bottle pocket on the side
Cons
  • Designed to fit only one racket

Sensible and timelessly stylish, Tumi’s tennis backpack makes a worthy investment for any serious player. Sans racket, it makes a practical travel backpack for players on the go.

Racket capacity: 1

Colors: Tan

Materials: Nylon with leather trim

Customer review: “Have received compliments and people asking who made it, saying they have not seen a tennis bag like this one. I was also pleased that it is lighter in weight than my last backpack.”

    Best Tennis-Inspired Canvas Tote Bag

    Sporty & Rich ’94 Racquet Club Two-Tone Tote

    Pros
    • Effortlessly versatile
    Cons
    • Not made specifically for tennis gear
    • No closure at the top opening

    Okay sure, it’s not a true tennis bag in the technical sense, but sometimes a classic canvas tote bag is just what you need. This one’s big enough to hold at least one racket, tennis balls, an extra set of clothes, and shoes. Plus, how can you ignore the cheeky racquet club-inspired embroidery?

    Racket Capacity: N/A

    Colors: Off-White and Navy

    Material: Cotton

    Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

    Best Tennis Tote Bag

    Caraa Tennis Quilted Backpack Tote

    Pros
    • Convertible design with hidden backpack straps
    • Water-repellant material is easy to wipe clean
    Cons
    • Racket pocket cannot be removed

    With numerous compartments for your water bottle, racket, tennis balls, and personal items, Caraa’s tennis tote bag makes a sensible pick for players of all skill levels. Clay court players will be happy to hear the quilted nylon design wipes clean easily, too.

    Racket capacity: 2

    Colors: Black, ivory

    Materials: Nylon

    Customer review: “Cute and so comfortable! I wasn’t expecting it to be so plush and soft, but it is... Love that it has a proper clip for closure and not just a magnet.”

    Best Courtside Tennis Bag

    Think Royln You Are the Champion Tennis Bag

    Pros
    • Detachable strap
    • Plenty of space and organizational pockets
    • Removable racket cover
    Cons
    • Puffer quilting not the best for those who want performance fabric

    If you’ve watched any of the Grand Slam tournaments, then you already know that part of the swag that these tennis players have is in the gear they carry to their spots on the court. Why not embody that with a bag like this one? It features an expandable zipper to hold up to two rackets, plenty of space for your essentials, interior and exterior pockets, and a detachable strap that you can use on the removable racket cover or the tote. Versatility at its finest.

    Racquet capacity: 2

    Colors: Black, Navy, White

    Material: Polyester

    Customer review: “Love my new tennis bag. The racket cover has a separate zipper to expand to fit two rackets. The inside is so roomy. I can fit my sneakers, cans of balls, water bottle, purse, towel, etc. I bought the white color, and it’s perfect. Have taken it to the club and outdoor courts, and everyone wanted to know where I got it. I also like that I can remove the racket cover and use the bag for travel.”

    Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

    The Best Tournament Merch

    Lacoste Unisex Roland-Garros Edition Tote

    Pros
    • Two interior pockets
    • Laptop sleeve
    • Versatile, open design
    Cons
    • Not specifically made for tennis gear

    Another canvas tote bag on the list, but hear me out: This was made for the Roland-Garros tournament (a.k.a. the French Open). Plus, this has more features than your average tote. It has a sleeve for your laptop and two interior pockets—one of which has a zipper for your more valuable things.

    Racket capacity: N/A

    Colors: Natural

    Material: Cotton

    Best Luxury Racket Cover

    Brunello Cucinelli Tennis Racket Cover

    Pros
    • Good for travel
    • Material is easy to clean
    Cons
    • No additional storage for other items

    For those who love the idea of investing in a racket cover that’s as luxurious as it is chic, this Bruno Cucinelli option is just what you need. Simple yet so sophisticated, this will be with you over the years—and lucky for you, tennis is a lifelong sport.

    .Racket capacity: 1

    Colors: Beige/White

    Materials: Polyester, Leather

    Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

    Best Personalized Tennis Bag

    Anya Hindmarch Bespoke Walton Tennis Bag

    Pros
    • Detachable tennis ball pouch
    • Can be monogrammed or embossed
    Cons
    • Custom product takes at least three weeks to arrive

    Few tennis bags feel as luxurious as those designed by Anya Hindmarch, and this bespoke mini duffel shows precisely why. Crafted from durable recycled canvas, it can be accented with leather initials or embossed with the name of your choice. With compartments for every piece of tennis equipment, it’ll become a cornerstone of your tennis style for decades to come.

    Racket capacity: 1

    Colors: Navy, Tan

    Materials: Recycled canvas with leather trim

    Best Commuter-Friendly Backpack

    Wilson Team Tennis Backpack

    Pros
    • Spacious
    • Separate compartment for shoes
    • Affordable
    Cons

      This is what I use, and it’s my go-to option for commuting to and from the courts on the subway. With the racket compartment, which can fit two rackets (but I’ve squeezed in a third), the rackets will sit upright against you, so there‘s no accidentally hitting someone in a crowded space. Plus, there’s enough room to fit shoes, a water bottle, two sleeves of balls, and extra clothes—all at this ultra-affordable price point. Need I say more?

      Racket capacity: 2

      Colors: Heather Grey

      Materials: Polyester

      Customer review: “The Wilson Team Tennis Racket Bag is exactly what I was looking for. It easily holds two rackets, making it great for practice or matches. The neutral heather green and grey color was a big hit with my teen daughter—she loves the stylish, understated look. It’s simple but functional, and the quality feels solid. Overall, a great bag for the price, and it’s become her go-to!”

      Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

      Best Convertible Tennis Bag

      MZ Wallace Tennis Convertible Backpack

      Pros
      • Can be worn as both a tote bag and a backpack
      • Zippered interior and exterior pockets keep small valuables secure
      Cons
      • Some reviewers wished the material had more structure

      From tennis to pickleball, this quilted MZ Wallace backpack can do it all. Top handles and adjustable shoulder straps allow it to be slung over your shoulder tote-style or slipped on as a backpack.

      Racket capacity: 2

      Colors: Black, navy, cornflower blue

      Materials: REC Oxford with leather trim

      Customer review: “Worth every penny. It has plenty of room for all your tennis gear with its varied compartments... Best tennis bag ever!”

      Best Leather Tennis Bag

      Louis Vuitton Suzanne Racket Pouch

      Pros
      • Comes with four Louis Vuitton tennis balls
      • Adjustable shoulder strap for comfort
      Cons
      • Not designed to hold multiple rackets

      Made from supple leather accented with the Maison’s signature monogram print, this Louis Vuitton tennis bag is a covetable collector’s piece for tennis players and handbag connoisseurs alike. An adjustable jacquard strap and zippered tennis ball compartment ensure your game-time essentials are always close by.

      Racket capacity: 1

      Colors: Brown

      Materials: Leather

      Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

      How to Choose a Tennis Bag

      The current tennis fashion trend can make it challenging to determine which tennis bags are for actual racket-carrying tennis players and which are for viewers in the stands adopting the tennis aesthetic. So, we asked Anisimova for tips on how to choose a tennis bag.

      Before shopping, you’ll need to determine what bag style and racket capacity you’re after. “A beginner player should shop for a tennis tote bag or backpack. Typically, when starting out, a player uses only two or three rackets, so a bag on the smaller side would be perfect. A professional player should opt for a six or even nine-racket bag,” says Anisimova.

      She carries her rackets in a Wilson Super Tour 6-Pack Tennis Bag during competitions, but prefers more casual tennis tote bags for training because they’re “stylish and easy to use.”

      What to Look for In a Tennis Bag

      According to Anisimova, the most important thing a tennis bag can do is keep you organized. Thankfully, there are plenty of totes, duffels, and backpacks that’ll do just that. Here are some practical design features to look for in a tennis bag:

      • Zippered interior and exterior pockets
      • Removable tennis racket pouch
      • Shoe compartment
      • Water bottle holder
      • Tennis ball compartment

      Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

      Meet the Expert

      Why Trust ELLE

      Every product featured on ELLE.com is independently researched, tested, or editor-approved. We only recommend products that we stand behind, and the merchandise featured on our site is always driven by editorial and product testing standards, not by affiliate deals or advertising relationships. Any content created in partnership with advertisers is marked as such.
